turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Parboiling.
turn.1: What is meant by parboiling and adobo?
turn.2: Parboiling  Parboiling (or leaching) is the partial or semi boiling of food as the first step in cooking.
turn.3: What is the origin of the word?
turn.4: The word is from the Old French 'parboillir' (to boil thoroughly) but by mistaken association with 'part' it has acquired its current meaning .
turn.6: The word is often used when referring to parboiled rice.
turn.8: Parboiling can also be used for removing poisonous or foul-tasting substances from foods, and to soften vegetables before roasting them.
turn.10: The food items are added to boiling water and cooked until they start to soften, then removed before they are fully cooked.
turn.11: Why are the food items removed before they are fully cooked?
turn.12: Parboiling is usually used to partially cook an item which will then be cooked another way such as braising, grilling, or stir-frying.
